document.title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards English Language Arts (NJSLS-ELA)

8C46B0BF49B945629BA7F0A6AFFB981E.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task
and situation.

530985EB29764476819569BFC684A6CD.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations
when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

5F9B9758D2FE40838A5EF0F2AEAD8F0F.description:
Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using
appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an
understandable pace.

ABCD24BF5DD14CA5AFCE34B01C7A5420.description:
Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons
and evidence.

D3A68FADA789411C97DEB108A70B6BB5.description:
Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats
(e.g., visually, quantitatively, and orally).

9BE059A63F1A4A6185BB832B71374364.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge
gained from the discussions.

DF494EF8DCF34E43BC1595F548E98788.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the
discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others.

4EB889C706B444DDA848F1EC2F751EFB.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

DB27FE6F4CD544FBA9569DEE9462A2FB.description:
Explicitly draw on previously read text or material and other information known about the
topic to explore ideas under discussion.

BC76BD7615B24F03BCA7A39DB0C109C4.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and
teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing
their own clearly.

387AAAE28F654F74BCE8907DA2FA7B38.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research and revision) and shorter time
frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

903AE3A2E8F44A878ED198B9457AA6B5.description:
Establish a central idea about a topic, investigation, issue or event and use several sources to
support the proposed central idea.

BD2EF8A341D9483DBA46443918388FEB.description:
After initial drafting, expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, audience, and
style.

EC6D24D0760047FAB606F6F657D2C8A8.description:
With adult and peer feedback, and digital or print tools such as a dictionary, thesaurus,
and/or spell checker, evaluate whether the writing achieved its goal and make changes in
content or form as necessary.

B0C69185E9F84F9DB4DF347A39F72A5A.description: Consider writing as a process, including self-evaluation, revision and editing.

26BEAD2D096444E7A4D27F5346140C8D.description:
Plan appropriately to use specialized, topic-specific language appropriate for the audience,
purpose and subject matter

8C9CA87165824B539508720E4E669036.description: Consider audience, purpose, and intent before writing.

DAFFFB1084284AEA9FD703ACEBF9B404.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed
by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

9B4613BF01D344E0A1B10206C9ADFD61.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

9687D18D3FD549A5A81FB1E40FCEA1C5.description:
Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events
precisely.

4746ECF9945645D9B823792CA7025F5B.description: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

460C5BA016C34E85A5F07AFF9D2F48CE.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences
and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

E145DA5CB750498887002E0743786A74.description:
Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters;
organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

DB0C9DF9084441C691FB34476C61D4AC.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique,
descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

6826E21EC04D4B47B1E720B533F59B51.description: Provide a conclusion related to the information of explanation presented.

ECC011379C9B45EA8C0215F58A7D51B2.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

74FDC1E8D3CC4C6DAE054555522A9423.description:
Link ideas within paragraphs and sections of information using words, phrases, and clauses
(e.g., in contrast, especially).

6A25932DDE674EDD880C95492E8A9546.description:
Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information
and examples related to the topic.

AC4037DD74E44AAC88A968F46B322996.description:
Introduce a topic clearly to provide a focus and group related information logically; include
text features such as headings, illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aid in
comprehension.

FE589BB1403B4BBD8F556CA121842A60.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information
clearly.

6D1DCC09B8894E6DAA611224B8EF12C3.description: Provide a conclusion related to the opinion presented.

169AC4C0CFFD4418A9344133C3E2AC52.description: Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically).

CDA0D50320944DC99153CEC53537FE51.description:
Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details from text(s), quote
directly from text when appropriate.

828757E931CD414FA5870608F3488C11.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in
which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer’s purpose.

5776780BE3FF4F7CB8658394800508B1.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and
information.

316B89F0BAF54C46BCDFD91641BA5B1A.description:
Compare and contrast the authors’ approaches across two or more informational texts within
the same genre or about texts on the same or similar topics.

60F522F0BDCD4AE3BF6CF3A09032B7AD.description:
Compare and contrast the authors’ approaches across two or more literary texts within the
same genre or about the same or similar topics

51888A2949FD4E0A92115B516D676A52.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text,
identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

66308406F4CF4559B23220596227B762.description:
Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs,
diagrams, timelines, animations, or interactive elements on web pages) and explain how the information
contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

58DF261181464975A0018785885A62C5.description:
Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a
text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

E77C43F409584B27ADF4DD90452F9673.description:
Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and
differences in the point of view they represent and how that may influence the reader’s interpretation.

8F99A0F6DC274ACC8B6FA90B2B72C3A8.description:
Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences how events are described, and
how that may influence the reader’s interpretation.

1DB0243FA4944825810099FDD5A56374.description:
Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect,
problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

1FDD387838224C1785424351AB9BA65F.description:
Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall
structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

C77C149BB5B3441AA96EEBC08D938BDD.description:
Analyze the impact of two or more individuals and events throughout the course of a text,
explaining the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts
in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific evidence in the text.

A195578E28AA47149FDC2B170D7B061D.description:
Analyze the impact of two or more individuals and events throughout the course of a text,
comparing and contrasting two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on
specific textual evidence (e.g., how characters interact).

BA544D8917BF41219057AFE877423FCF.description:
Determine the central idea of an informational text and explain how it is supported by key
details; summarize the text.

F7EE766D4657463CA9229E513D4DBB11.description:
Determine the theme of a literary text (e.g., stories, plays or poetry) and explain how it is
supported by key details; summarize the text.

ED4B9FD9C90E486FAD541ABDE23B0FD0.description:
Quote accurately from an informational text when explaining what the text says explicitly and
make relevant connections when drawing inferences from the text.

ADAFA5A8FE2E421C9458B002B66C8EB0.description:
Quote accurately from a literary text when explaining what the text says explicitly and make
relevant connections when drawing inferences from the text.

CE9F78F065AB481D85C9AB2AB2B4C019.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to
better understand each of the words.

6B395C5C947F440281DF7D0E7115D680.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

4B78D70F624A4AC4A26F54D94C9CA720.description: Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

F5DF82581BA4407689E562AE7159CA98.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word
meanings.

12ED3C6558D3482E8833705971D51C98.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and
digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words
and phrases.

8C18951589904D8CA750846E46EF6FD4.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of
a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

8771309D1F5F4C3780D44FD9A905736E.description:
Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the
meaning of a word or phrase.

63D4ECB0BFED40639F9407291264E275.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning academic and
domain-specific words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range
of strategies.

99A72D1E19FE4DFBA11CF8EBB5C9D595.description:
Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in stories,
dramas, or poems.

275D970B683C4FEB8BE20A2BF84A90FC.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

EDE7D69B4A574F07829C9B683B993D03.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words
and phrases.

68D709DE0BA8412F8A6D06FAF97CA2EC.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

08BD2B6A39EB4D0D8501117D75026155.description: Spell grade appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

F5DCEBDE3D734E5AB0FF474CAD0B3EEB.description:
Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence; use a
comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It’s true, isn’t it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that
you, Emma?).

1B24938F32DE4162815357B1FCB7CFAA.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series; use commas in a series of phrases or clauses.

E109ED5D954A40B1929E482863C520B9.description: Use idiomatic language and choose words for effect; use punctuating for meaning and effect.

55C27841EA0C4DE6BA9E33F65C206E86.description: Ensure agreement between subject and verb and between pronoun and antecedent.

1DB2313406B148A0B1C0C1C95FA24744.description:
Maintain consistency in verb tense; place phrases and clauses; choose between adjectives
and adverbs.

44A55215D9F84848945C3E2D036CB5EE.description: Avoid fragments, run-ons and rambling sentences, and comma splices.

6B93626E90264F1D8EA88FA0A063DD44.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of writing, including those listed under grade four
foundational skills.

8EA30192B994414DA32141F86F061429.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

8F4BD1512136464DB3B5A4CA1CAA0074.description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

7683FC4C57F5415CBB0DE5D3A933DF4B.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

51A51E8D03D04C89834E83D977337ADD.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
